required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating Safety and Immunogenicity of 13-Valent Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine With Influenza Vaccine in Adults
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Randomized, Double-blind Trial to Evaluate Safety, Tolerability, and Immunogenicity of a 13-Valent Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine When Administered Concomitantly With Trivalent Inactivated Influenza Vaccine in Healthy Adults 65 Years of Age or Older, Who Are Naive to 23-Valent Pneumococcal Polysaccharide Vaccine

brief_summary.textblock: The 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) is being developed for adults to prevent pneumococcal diseases such as meningitis (inflammation of the brain lining), septicemia (blood poisoning), and pneumonia (inflammation of the lungs). As trivalent influenza vaccine (TIV) is frequently given to adults, it is important to show that both vaccines can safely be given together without affecting the immune response (body's ability to protect against disease).

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: TIV Comparisons: Percentage of Participants Achieving at Least a 4-fold Increase in the Titer of the Standard Hemagglutination Inhibition Assay (HAI)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 1 month after TIV vaccination
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving at least a 4-fold increase in the titer of the standard HAI for each influenza virus subtype (A/H1N1, A/H3N2, and B) were compared.

primary_outcome.measure: 13vPnC Comparisons: Serotype-specific Pneumococcal Immunoglobulin G (IgG) Geometric Mean Concentration (GMC)
primary_outcome.description: IgG GMC as measured by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) and expressed in micrograms per mL (mcg/mL) for serotypes 1, 3, 4, 5, 6A, 6B, 7F, 9V, 14, 18C, 19A, 19F and 23F.

intervention.description: Single 0.5 milliliter (mL) 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) and a single 0.5 mL trivalent inactivated influenza vaccine (TIV), administered intramuscularly (IM), followed by a single 0.5 mL vaccine 13vPnC placebo, 1 month later.
Single 0.5 mL 13vPnC placebo vaccine and a single 0.5 mL TIV, administered IM, followed by a single 0.5 mL 13vPnC vaccine, 1 month later.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Generally healthy male or female adults 65 years of age or older.
- Available for the duration of the trial - approximately 2 months.
- No previous vaccination with any pneumococcal vaccine.
- No history of severe adverse reaction associated with a vaccine.
- No allergy to egg proteins (eggs or egg products) and chicken proteins.

overall_official.affiliation: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 1185 participants were enrolled, of which 1160 were randomized.

group.title: 13vPnC+TIV Followed by Placebo 1 Month Later
group.description: Single 0.5 milliliter (mL) 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) and a single 0.5 mL trivalent inactivated influenza vaccine (TIV), administered intramuscularly (IM), followed by a single 0.5 mL 13vPnC placebo vaccine, 1 month later.

group.title: Placebo+TIV Followed by 13vPnC 1 Month Later
group.description: Single 0.5 mL 13vPnC placebo vaccine and a single 0.5 mL TIV, administered IM, followed by a single 0.5 mL 13vPnC, 1 month later.

group.title: 13vPnC+TIV Followed by Placebo 1 Month Later
group.description: Single 0.5 milliliter (mL) 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) and a single 0.5 mL trivalent inactivated influenza vaccine (TIV), administered intramuscularly (IM), followed by a single 0.5 mL 13vPnC placebo vaccine, 1 month later.

group.title: Placebo+TIV Followed by 13vPnC 1 Month Later
group.description: Single 0.5 mL 13vPnC placebo vaccine and a single 0.5 mL TIV, administered IM, followed by a single 0.5 mL 13vPnC, 1 month later.

measure.title: Age
measure.description: Data for participants in the safety population (ie. those who received at least 1 dose of study vaccine) are presented. The number of participants equals the number receiving Dose 1 in the Participant Flow section (1152), minus 1 participant in the "13vPnC+TIV followed by placebo 1 month later" group who received a regimen that was not part of the study.

measure.title: Gender
measure.description: Data for participants in the safety population (ie. those who received at least 1 dose of study vaccine) are presented. The number of participants equals the number receiving Dose 1 in the Participant Flow section (1152), minus 1 participant in the "13vPnC+TIV followed by placebo 1 month later" group who received a regimen that was not part of the study.

outcome.title: TIV Comparisons: Percentage of Participants Achieving at Least a 4-fold Increase in the Titer of the Standard Hemagglutination Inhibition Assay (HAI)
outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving at least a 4-fold increase in the titer of the standard HAI for each influenza virus subtype (A/H1N1, A/H3N2, and B) were compared.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 1 month after TIV vaccination
outcome.population: Evaluable immunogenicity population: had participants who adhered to protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no major protocol violations.

group.title: 13vPnC+TIV
group.description: Single 0.5 milliliter (mL) 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) and a single 0.5 mL trivalent inactivated influenza vaccine (TIV), administered intramuscularly (IM).

group.title: Placebo+TIV
group.description: Single 0.5 mL 13vPnC placebo vaccine and a single 0.5 mL TIV, administered IM.

measure.title: TIV Comparisons: Percentage of Participants Achieving at Least a 4-fold Increase in the Titer of the Standard Hemagglutination Inhibition Assay (HAI)
measure.description: Percentage of participants achieving at least a 4-fold increase in the titer of the standard HAI for each influenza virus subtype (A/H1N1, A/H3N2, and B) were compared.
measure.population: Evaluable immunogenicity population: had participants who adhered to protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no major protocol violations.

analysis.groups_desc: Influenza virus subtype: A/H1N1. Primary null hypothesis for each of the influenza virus subtypes is: proportion of participants achieving a 4-fold increase in titer when 13vPnC+TIV were administered concomitantly, minus the proportion of participants achieving a 4-fold increase in titer when TIV was administered alone (with placebo) <= -0.10.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for a given virus subtype was demonstrated if the lower bound of the 2-sided, 95% confidence interval (CI), computed using the Chan and Zhang procedure, for the difference in proportions (13vPnC+TIV – TIV alone) was greater than –0.10.

analysis.groups_desc: Influenza virus subtype: A/H3N2. Primary null hypothesis for each of the influenza virus subtypes is: proportion of participants achieving a 4-fold increase in titer when 13vPnC+TIV were administered concomitantly, minus the proportion of participants achieving a 4-fold increase in titer when TIV was administered alone (with placebo) <= -0.10.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for a given virus subtype was demonstrated if the lower bound of the 2-sided, 95% CI, computed using the Chan and Zhang procedure, for the difference in proportions (13vPnC+TIV – TIV alone) was greater than –0.10.

analysis.groups_desc: Influenza virus subtype: B. Primary null hypothesis for each of the influenza virus subtypes is: proportion of participants achieving a 4-fold increase in titer when 13vPnC+TIV were administered concomitantly, minus the proportion of participants achieving a 4-fold increase in titer when TIV was administered alone (with placebo) <= -0.10.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for a given virus subtype was demonstrated if the lower bound of the 2-sided, 95% CI, computed using the Chan and Zhang procedure, for the difference in proportions (13vPnC+TIV – TIV alone) was greater than –0.10.

outcome.title: 13vPnC Comparisons: Serotype-specific Pneumococcal Immunoglobulin G (IgG) Geometric Mean Concentration (GMC)
outcome.description: IgG GMC as measured by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) and expressed in micrograms per mL (mcg/mL) for serotypes 1, 3, 4, 5, 6A, 6B, 7F, 9V, 14, 18C, 19A, 19F and 23F.
outcome.population: Evaluable immunogenicity population: had participants who adhered to protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no major protocol violations.

group.title: 13vPnC+TIV
group.description: Single 0.5 milliliter (mL) 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) and a single 0.5 mL trivalent inactivated influenza vaccine (TIV), administered intramuscularly (IM).

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Single 0.5 mL 13vPnC (administered 1 month after single 0.5 mL 13vPnC placebo vaccine and a single 0.5 mL TIV, IM).

measure.title: 13vPnC Comparisons: Serotype-specific Pneumococcal Immunoglobulin G (IgG) Geometric Mean Concentration (GMC)
measure.description: IgG GMC as measured by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) and expressed in micrograms per mL (mcg/mL) for serotypes 1, 3, 4, 5, 6A, 6B, 7F, 9V, 14, 18C, 19A, 19F and 23F.
measure.population: Evaluable immunogenicity population: had participants who adhered to protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no major protocol violations.

analysis.groups_desc: Serotype 1. The primary null hypothesis was: the log of the GMC in the group receiving 13vPnC and TIV concomitantly, minus the log of the GMC in the group receiving 13vPnC alone (1 month after TIV) <= -0.693.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The criterion upon which to declare non-inferiority was the lower bound of the 2-sided, 95% CI for the geometric mean ratio greater than 0.5 (2-fold criterion).
analysis.estimate_desc: CIs for the ratio were back transformations of the CIs based on the Student t distribution for the mean difference of the logarithmically transformed assay results.

analysis.groups_desc: Serotype 3. The primary null hypothesis was: the log of the GMC in the group receiving 13vPnC and TIV concomitantly, minus the log of the GMC in the group receiving 13vPnC alone (1 month after TIV) <= -0.693.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The criterion upon which to declare non-inferiority was the lower bound of the 2-sided, 95% CI for the geometric mean ratio greater than 0.5 (2-fold criterion).
analysis.estimate_desc: CIs for the ratio were back transformations of the CIs based on the Student t distribution for the mean difference of the logarithmically transformed assay results.

analysis.groups_desc: Serotype 4. The primary null hypothesis was: the log of the GMC in the group receiving 13vPnC and TIV concomitantly, minus the log of the GMC in the group receiving 13vPnC alone (1 month after TIV) <= -0.693.

analysis.estimate_desc: CIs for the ratio were back transformations of the CIs based on the Student t distribution for the mean difference of the logarithmically transformed assay results.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Pre-specified Local Reactions
outcome.description: Local reactions were reported using an electronic diary. Pain was scaled as Any; Mild (awareness but easily tolerated); Moderate (discomfort enough to interfere with usual activity) and Severe (incapacitating the usual activity). Redness and swelling were scaled as Any; Mild (2.5 cm to 5.0 cm); Moderate (5.1 to 10.0 cm)and Severe (> 10.0 cm). Limitation in arm movement were scaled as Any; Mild (some limitation); Moderate (unable to move above head but able to move above shoulder) and Severe (unable to move above shoulder).
outcome.population: Safety population: included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study vaccine. n=number of participants at each timepoint, in each group respectively.

group.title: 13vPnC+TIV
group.description: Single 0.5 milliliter (mL) 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) and a single 0.5 mL trivalent inactivated influenza vaccine (TIV), administered intramuscularly (IM).

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Single 0.5 mL 13vPnC (administered 1 month after single 0.5 mL 13vPnC placebo vaccine and a single 0.5 mL TIV, IM).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Pre-specified Local Reactions
measure.description: Local reactions were reported using an electronic diary. Pain was scaled as Any; Mild (awareness but easily tolerated); Moderate (discomfort enough to interfere with usual activity) and Severe (incapacitating the usual activity). Redness and swelling were scaled as Any; Mild (2.5 cm to 5.0 cm); Moderate (5.1 to 10.0 cm)and Severe (> 10.0 cm). Limitation in arm movement were scaled as Any; Mild (some limitation); Moderate (unable to move above head but able to move above shoulder) and Severe (unable to move above shoulder).
measure.population: Safety population: included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study vaccine. n=number of participants at each timepoint, in each group respectively.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Pre-specified Systemic Events
outcome.description: Systemic events (Any fever >= 38 degrees Celsius [C]), fatigue, headache, chills, rash, vomiting, decreased appetite, new muscle pain, any aggravated muscle pain, new joint pain or any aggravated joint pain. Participants may be presented in more than one category.
outcome.population: Safety population: included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study vaccine. n=number of participants at each timepoint, in each group respectively.

group.title: 13vPnC+TIV
group.description: Single 0.5 milliliter (mL) 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) and a single 0.5 mL trivalent inactivated influenza vaccine (TIV), administered intramuscularly (IM).

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Single 0.5 mL 13vPnC (administered 1 month after single 0.5 mL 13vPnC placebo vaccine and a single 0.5 mL TIV, IM).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Pre-specified Systemic Events
measure.description: Systemic events (Any fever >= 38 degrees Celsius [C]), fatigue, headache, chills, rash, vomiting, decreased appetite, new muscle pain, any aggravated muscle pain, new joint pain or any aggravated joint pain. Participants may be presented in more than one category.
measure.population: Safety population: included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study vaccine. n=number of participants at each timepoint, in each group respectively.

outcome.title: 13vPnC Comparisons: Serotype-specific Opsonophagocytic Activity (OPA) Geometric Mean Titers (GMT)
outcome.description: Pneumococcal OPA GMTs for 13 pneumococcal serotypes (1, 3, 4, 5, 6A, 6B, 7F, 9V, 14, 18C, 19A, 19F, and 23F) were determined in the blood samples of a subset of participants using a microcolony OPA (mcOPA) assay.
outcome.population: Evaluable immunogenicity population: had participants who adhered to protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no major protocol violations. n= number of participants with a determinate OPA antibody titer to the given serotype.

group.title: 13vPnC+TIV
group.description: Single 0.5 milliliter (mL) 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) and a single 0.5 mL trivalent inactivated influenza vaccine (TIV), administered intramuscularly (IM).

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Single 0.5 mL 13vPnC (administered 1 month after single 0.5 mL 13vPnC placebo vaccine and a single 0.5 mL TIV, IM).

measure.title: 13vPnC Comparisons: Serotype-specific Opsonophagocytic Activity (OPA) Geometric Mean Titers (GMT)
measure.description: Pneumococcal OPA GMTs for 13 pneumococcal serotypes (1, 3, 4, 5, 6A, 6B, 7F, 9V, 14, 18C, 19A, 19F, and 23F) were determined in the blood samples of a subset of participants using a microcolony OPA (mcOPA) assay.
measure.population: Evaluable immunogenicity population: had participants who adhered to protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no major protocol violations. n= number of participants with a determinate OPA antibody titer to the given serotype.

analysis.groups_desc: Serotype 1. The primary null hypothesis was: the log of the GMT in the group receiving 13vPnC + TIV minus the log of the GMT in the group receiving 13vPnC alone (1 month after TIV) <= -0.693.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The criterion upon which to declare non-inferiority was if the lower limit of the 2-sided 95%CI for the GMT ratios, (13vPnC+TIV relative to 13vPnC administered 1 month after TIV+placebo) was greater than 0.5 (2-fold criterion).
analysis.estimate_desc: 2-sided 95% CIs for the GMT ratio were calculated by back transformations of the 95% CIs based on the Student t distribution for the mean difference of the logarithmically transformed assay results.

analysis.groups_desc: Serotype 3. The primary null hypothesis was: the log of the GMT in the group receiving 13vPnC + TIV minus the log of the GMT in the group receiving 13vPnC alone (1 month after TIV) <= -0.693.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The criterion upon which to declare non-inferiority was if the lower limit of the 2-sided 95%CI for the GMT ratios, (13vPnC+TIV relative to 13vPnC administered 1 month after TIV+placebo) was greater than 0.5 (2-fold criterion).
analysis.estimate_desc: 2-sided 95% CIs for the GMT ratio were calculated by back transformations of the 95% CIs based on the Student t distribution for the mean difference of the logarithmically transformed assay results.

analysis.groups_desc: Serotype 19F. The primary null hypothesis was: the log of the GMT in the group receiving 13vPnC + TIV minus the log of the GMT in the group receiving 13vPnC alone (1 month after TIV) <= -0.693.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The criterion upon which to declare non-inferiority was if the lower limit of the 2-sided 95%CI for the GMT ratios, (13vPnC+TIV relative to 13vPnC administered 1 month after TIV+placebo) was greater than 0.5 (2-fold criterion).
analysis.estimate_desc: 2-sided 95% CIs for the GMT ratio were calculated by back transformations of the 95% CIs based on the Student t distribution for the mean difference of the logarithmically transformed assay results.

analysis.groups_desc: Serotype 23F. The primary null hypothesis was: the log of the GMT in the group receiving 13vPnC + TIV minus the log of the GMT in the group receiving 13vPnC alone (1 month after TIV) <= -0.693.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The criterion upon which to declare non-inferiority was if the lower limit of the 2-sided 95%CI for the GMT ratios, (13vPnC+TIV relative to 13vPnC administered 1 month after TIV+placebo) was greater than 0.5 (2-fold criterion).
analysis.estimate_desc: 2-sided 95% CIs for the GMT ratio were calculated by back transformations of the 95% CIs based on the Student t distribution for the mean difference of the logarithmically transformed assay results.

reported_events.time_frame: AEs/SAEs recorded from signing of informed consent form to completion of study (Visit 3).Participants recorded in the e-diary their local reactions,systemic events & use of antipyretic & pain medication (Day 1-Day 14 after study vaccine administration).
reported_events.desc: SAEs were grouped by organ system, with number and frequency of events summarized. Non-serious AEs were summarized in a similar manner and included solicited AEs collected in the e-diary (systematic assessment) and unsolicited events collected on the case report form at each visit (non-systematic assessment).

group.title: 13vPnC+TIV
group.description: Single 0.5 mL 13vPnC and a single 0.5 mL TIV, administered IM.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Single 0.5 mL 13vPnC placebo vaccine (administered 1 month after a single 0.5 mL 13vPnC and a single 0.5 mL TIV, IM [13vPnC + TIV]).

group.title: Placebo+TIV
group.description: Single 0.5 mL 13vPnC placebo vaccine and a single 0.5 mL TIV, administered IM.

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Single 0.5 mL 13vPnC (administered 1 month after single 0.5 mL 13vPnC placebo vaccine and a single 0.5 mL TIV, IM [Placebo + TIV]).

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Fever ≥ 38 degrees C but < 38.5 degrees C
Fever ≥ 38.5 degrees C but < 39 degrees C
Fever ≥ 39 degrees C but ≤ 40.0 degrees C

event.description: Redness (any) = present at site of vaccination
Swelling (any) = present at site of vaccination
Pain (any) = present at site of vaccination
Pain (mild) = awareness of symptoms but easily tolerated
Pain (moderate) = discomfort enough to cause interference with usual activity
Pain (severe) = unable to move above shoulder
Limitation of arm movement (mild) = some limitation
Limitation of arm movement (moderate) = unable to move above head but able to move above shoulder
Limitation of arm movement (severe) = unable to move above shoulder

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
